intro: Cupia densiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered cupia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, showy flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, giving them a velvety texture. Cupia densiflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along riverbanks.
